title.label: Not as enjoyable as I'd hoped

content.label:
There are a few things about S2 that I think are great; the world selection (and that they're separated out individually), the online "battles" (although I'm still not sure how that really works, but it's interesting), the costumes.

But, it feels like every possible freemium mechanic has been crammed into the game.  Between the energy system, the earnings rate & IAP costs of stars/diamonds compared to store/revive costs, the costs of failing a level (you lose badges, the tick of energy you spent engaging the level, the level resets to wave 1, and it apparently re-locks other zones that were previously open ~ which (sometimes?) cost diamonds to re-open)... combined with the game play itself (and that it can be very                    time-sensitive, yet is not totally reliable about recognizing/accepting a symbol) ~ altogether, the mechanics just feel overly harshly punitive.  I'm actually -less- inclined to make any purchases because it doesn't seem like it's worth it and I believe I'll just end up feeling like I wasted money.

I'm not totally positive if the areas are -supposed- to re-lock; the game seems to be slightly confused about which zone is which; for example, when I select the Graveyard (which was open for play initially), it now is locked to me, does not offer the option of paying to unlock it, and tells me "You haven't unlocked Hills yet."

As some other reviews mentioned...
‚Ä¢ The first time I installed, I got "stuck" in the tutorial; at the point where I was supposed to make a combo, it simply stopped recognizing symbols and I was unable to continue; the pause button and ability to quit the level still worked, but doing so apparently counted as a loss/death.
‚Ä¢ I deleted and reinstalled; after a couple attempts I was able to finish the tutorial, but the game kept finding the other iCloud save(s?) and asking me about them.
‚Ä¢ In the Forest; once I had progressed far enough for Mia (the "flying" Crawler) to appear... yeah, it shows up in the earlier waves now and is just making life miserable.  The game seems especially prone to not-recognizing that particular symbol during waves and the speed and movement paths of the critter tend to leave no room for error (if you have time to do anything at all... often as not it makes for a situation of insta-fail, and considering what happens when you fail a level... it's just frustrating).  I'm halfway tempted to re-install again and avoid progressing that far just to get rid of the thing.
‚Ä¢ The story line isn't terribly thoroughly explained, and while the tutorial (when you can complete it, anyways) covers some of the basics, I think I'd feel a little lost if I hadn't played the first game and seen most of the general game mechanics elsewhere.  And I still have questions ~ like not being totally sure how the online teams/battles work and what exactly counts as participation, why zones are re-locking and if/how that can be avoided, I'm not sure what XP and leveling up does for you or what the benefits to the ranks (Newbie, Sergeant, etc) are (at some point I went from 5 energy to 10, but I'm not sure why/how/where-that-came-from), if there's any significance to the league/global/team ranks, I've unlocked the bonus level a couple times but am not sure -how- I got there (all I know is that it doesn't automatically happen each time you defeat a boss the way it does in the first game).

I'm still playing, for now, but am not sure how long the game will hold my interest as it is.  Hoping to see some tuning/adjustments /changes with the mechanics to make the game a little more forgiving and less pointlessly-frustrating.

title.label: What happened to my favorite game?

content.label:
The original was the greatest game I have ever played on a mobile device. The original had wonderful mechanics, great visuals, and was just plain fun...
I don't know whose idea at Mildnania it was to adopt the pay to win and pay to play marketing strategies, but I miss the company who cared about it's customers and fan base. 
Please revert back to the post-greed version. I have waited for this game ever since the day the original game came out.

title.label: Well designed, some areas to improve

content.label:
I started out a few months back playing the original darklings. I enjoyed it but was a bit unsatisfied. When darklings 2 came out, I thought I should try it out, because maybe it would be better. This app has the same detailed and eye pleasing graphics as the original. It brings a lot of new features to the table and still keeps the unique and interactive feel of the older darklings. Unfortunately, even with all these updates, a number of issues from the original still remain unfixed. For one, the tutorials are quite unclear and you basically have to figure out how to play through experimentation. Furthermore, the overall plot and storyline remain largely untouched and quite vague. I would also like to add that some of the dialogue is pointless and could be reworded to make more sense.

Overall, although the unique gameplay holds your attention for quite some time, it has some flaws which prevent me from giving it a five star rating.

title.label: Five Stars, Now That I Can Play It.

content.label: The game concept itself is good, good graphics, never crashes (now with the new update, of course,) all in all a five star game.

Update***

The game plays now so that's a good start.  As I said below I really liked the first Darklings so I kind of figured I would like this one as well.  While it isn't a bad game there is something missing I can't quite put my finger on.  First of all this one does a much better job at figuring out what shape you are trying to draw.  My deaths due to it not recognizing what I drew are a thing of the past.  That brings me to my first issue with the game and that is all the enemies and even the bosses just seem recycled from the first one.  I admit that I am not very far though so hopefully that changes (If it does I apologize and will probably add another star).  My other issue is just how the leveling and such is structured.  Why does my level go up and down and there is very little in the way of explaining what the teams are for and several other things that need to be explained a little better.  This could be my stupidity or perhaps I skipped some tutorials or something on accident.  

The gameplay itself seems very polished but sometimes I need something to push me a long that makes me want to progress further.  What that is though, I could not tell you.

Old Review***

Loved the first Darklings and I am sure I would love this one too if it worked.  Please fix the game and I will adjust my review accordingly.

title.label: Worst game tutorial I've ever seen!

content.label: Improve your tutorial, would help if the finger movements(attacks) were displayed on the side of the screen.
This game keeps crashing on my iPad 2 so I couldn't even play the game

I enjoyed Darklings 1, and this is a great expansion on the original concept. Regarding micro transactions, I'm fine if you charge for premium characters/items, and compared to other games, the prices are fair. However, locking levels after I lose is silly! I'm stuck replaying the old levels until I'm out of energy. The 1 hour/energy recharge is also rather slow - more appropriate would be 20-30 minutes.
Also, I find it harder than the original (I'm level 10 now; those flying ones that swoop to attack are killing me badly, even in first wave of first level). I consider myself an experienced player, so I can only imagine how new players must be feeling. The tutorial in Darklings 1 was a great way to ease people into the game - five the player the first enemy of a round as a freebie, and freeze time until they get the symbol right.
